maintainers.bio: I taught myself Haskell as a logical next step after having learned OCaml. Although I don't use it for my job, I find it an interesting language; I especially enjoy its type system. I'm mostly a "break glass in case of emergency" maintainer.
In a world plagued by mutability, where side-effects scorch the land, a hobbyist programmer joins a fellowship of coders to save The Source.

maintainers.name: Simon Shine
maintainers.bio: I've been a classroom teacher in compilers and various functional languages for five years. Having pure functions and isolation of side-effects are fundamental to separation of concerns. Strong, static types, type inference and algebraic types are hard for me to live without.

maintainers.name: Adam Morris
maintainers.bio: Front-end web developer with years of experience using JavaScript, but learning a functional approach to web development using PureScript and Haskell

maintainers.name: J.R. "hiljusti" Hill
maintainers.bio: Build automation engineer at AWS by day, language enthusiast and tinkerer by night.
